![career, opportunities, DevOps, jobs](https://devops.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/CareerChange-150x150.jpg)A weekly DevOps Jobs Report featuring opportunities, salaries and insights into the DevOps job market from companies like NVIDIA and GEICO.

# Sign up for our newsletter! Stay informed on the latest DevOps news

Five Great DevOps Job Opportunities

DevOps.com is now providing a weekly DevOps jobs report through which opportunities for DevOps professionals will be highlighted as part of an effort to better serve our audience.

Our goal in these challenging economic times is to make it just that much easier for DevOps professionals to advance their careers.

Of course, the pool of available DevOps talent is still relatively constrained, so when one DevOps professional takes on a new role, it tends to create opportunities for others.

The five job postings shared this week are selected based on the company looking to hire, the vertical industry segment and naturally, the pay scale being offered.

We’re also committed to providing [additional insights](https://devops.com/essential-soft-skills-for-devops-professionals-in-the-ai-age/) into the state of the DevOps job market. In the meantime, for your consideration.

**Dice.com**

Executive Security as a Strategic Priority

Step 1 of 8

12%

Which best describes your level of influence on cybersecurity, risk and/or data protection in your organization?(Required) I make decisions about or have influence over cybersecurity strategy

I make decisions about or have influence over risk strategy

I am responsible for protecting data at my organization

I am responsible for building and/or implementing solutions that protect the PII of employees and customers

I am responsible for building and/or implementing solutions to underpin our cybersecurity strategy

I am responsible for building and/or implementing solutions to manage and mitigate risk

Other/NA

Have you or members of your family or other executives and members of their families been targets of social engineering attacks? (Select All That Apply)(Required) I have personally been targeted

A member of my family has been targeted

Executives at my organization have been targets of AI social engineering attacks

Were any of the attacks successful?(Required) Yes

No

Don’t know

N/A

Which best describes your organization’s efforts to protect executives and their families against AI social engineering attacks?(Required) Has taken rudimentary steps to protect executives and their families

Has discussed the potential impact of such attacks but has not executed a strategy

Has not addressed the impact of these attacks

Has made protecting executive PII a strategic priority and has a fully executed plan in place

Has developed a strategy to protect executives and has begun to execute it

What challenges have prevented you from more fully securing the PII of executives and their families?(Required) Integration into existing security strategies

Ease of use

Potential disruption to business operations

Tech spend is too high

Lack of executive/board support

Poor visibility into what should be protected

Which of the following do you think are true about the level of threat posed by AI social engineering attacks?(Required) Executives have often handled the most sensitive data—often on the fly—and have access to a company’s most valuable assets from their homes and personal devices

Protecting executives—and their families—should be a critical risk management priority

My organization doesn’t have a firm understanding of the risk from AI social engineering attacks

AI social engineering attacks raise my organization’s risk exposure

Obtaining executives’ available personal data online and that of their families can create extremely important leverage for threat actors seeking access to corporate assets

AI social engineering attacks against executives and their families are on the rise, and we struggle to stay ahead of them

What steps has your organization taken to protect executives and their families from AI social engineering attacks? (Select All That Apply)(Required) Protect the integrity of confidential information and communications

Reduce attack surface

Block lateral movement

Invest in training

How valuable do you think it would it be to have an easy to integrate and use tool that protects the PII of executives and their families from AI social engineering attacks?(Required) Extremely valuable

Very valuable

Somewhat valuable

Slightly valuable

Not valuable
